stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Phishing Email With a Purchase Order Theme Includes a ZIP-File Attachment
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 31 August 2014 a single email was observed from dispatch@sinatransport.com with the subject line "New Order P.O 31-08-2014". The email included a ZIP file attachment that contained a malicious executable file.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: ----- BEGIN EMAIL HEADERS -----220 [REDACTED] ESMTP Sun, 31 Aug 2014 13:17:33 -0500 EHLO smtp2.uia.net 250-[REDACTED] Hello smtp2.uia.net [66.146.0.42], pleased to meet you250-ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES250-PIPELINING250-8BITMIME250 STARTTLS MAIL From:<Dispatch@sinatransport.com> 250 2.1.0 Sender ok RCPT To:[REDACTED]DATA 250 2.1.5 Recipient ok354 Enter mail, end with "." on a line by itself Received: from User ([37.59.217.219])(authenticated bits=0)by smtp2.uia.net (8.14.5/8.14.2/4.0) with ESMTP id s7VIGm6Q081242;Sun, 31 Aug 2014 11:16:54 -0700 (PDT)Message-Id: <201408311816.s7VIGm6Q081242@smtp2.uia.net>Reply-To: <abscollen@hotmail.com>From: "Newtech Ltd"<Dispatch@sinatransport.com>Subject: New Order P.O 31-08-2014Date: Sun, 31 Aug 2014 11:17:13 -0700MIME-Version: 1.0Content-Type: multipart/mixed;boundary="----=_NextPart_000_0076_01C2A9A6.572752EE"X-Priority: 3X-MSMail-Priority: NormalX-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2600.0000X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2600.0000X-Greylist: Sender succeeded SMTP AUTH, not delayed by milter-greylist-4.0 (smtp2.uia.net [66.146.0.42]); Sun, 31 Aug 2014 11:17:27 -0700 (PDT)This is a multi-part message in MIME format.------=_NextPart_000_0076_01C2A9A6.572752EEContent-Type: text/plain;charset="Windows-1251"Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit----- END EMAIL HEADERS ---------- BEGIN EMAIL BODY ------ Dear,Please find the attached Purchase Offer "PO-67437848487" and send us your quote.Also include the minimum order quantity MQO, CIF, Taxes and expected date of delivery,Kind regards,Ed NuttengP. manager----- END EMAIL BODY ------The following information was yielded upon further investigation of the sender IP address 37.59.217.219:Network Whois recordQueried whois.ripe.net with "-B 37.59.217.219"...% Information related to \'37.59.217.192 - 37.59.217.223\'% Abuse contact for \'37.59.217.192 - 37.59.217.223\' is \'abuse@ovh.net\'inetnum: 37.59.217.192 - 37.59.217.223netname: OVH_57903159descr: OVHcountry: FRorg: ORG-ML215-RIPEadmin-c: OTC2-RIPEtech-c: OTC2-RIPEstatus: ASSIGNED PAmnt-by: OVH-MNTchanged: noc@ovh.net 20140319source: RIPEorganisation: ORG-ML215-RIPEorg-name: MyDedis Limitedorg-type: OTHERaddress: BLOCK A, 15/F., HILLIER COMM. BLDG., 65-67 BONHAM STRAND EASTaddress: SHEUNG WANaddress: Hong Konge-mail: sales@mydedis.comabuse-mailbox: abuse@mydedis.commnt-ref: OVH-MNTmnt-by: OVH-MNTchanged: noc@ovh.net 20121030source: RIPErole: OVH Technical Contactaddress: OVH SASaddress: 2 rue Kellermannaddress: 59100 Roubaixaddress: Francee-mail: noc@ovh.netadmin-c: OK217-RIPEtech-c: GM84-RIPEtech-c: SL10162-RIPEnic-hdl: OTC2-RIPEnotify: noc@ovh.netabuse-mailbox: abuse@ovh.netmnt-by: OVH-MNTchanged: noc@ovh.net 20101005source: RIPE% Information related to \'37.59.0.0/16AS16276\'route: 37.59.0.0/16descr: OVH ISPdescr: Paris, Franceorigin: AS16276notify: noc@ovh.netmnt-by: OVH-MNTchanged: noc@ovh.net 20120125source: RIPE% This query was served by the RIPE Database Query Service version 1.75 (DB-2)-- end --Open source resource search on IP address 37.59.217.219 identified thirteen (13) resource records. Further open source investigation found that an intrusion detection system (IDS) alerted for possible Zeus activity associated with the identified IP address and domains.
A compressed file (ZIP file) that contained a malicious executable file was included as an attachment with the email. The hash of the malicious executable was provided by the data source.
